meanings.definition: characteristic of or resembling a clerk
meanings.sent1: Her clerkish attire consisted of a neat shirt and trousers.
meanings.sent2: The office had a clerkish atmosphere with papers neatly stacked on desks.
meanings.sent3: He tried to look clerkish by wearing a fake mustache and glasses.
meanings.sent4: The room's organization was so clerkish, it seemed like a scene from a movie.
meanings.sent5: The clerkish behavior of the new employee made him stand out among his colleagues.

meanings.definition: relating to the work or duties of a clerk
meanings.sent1: The clerkish tasks involved filing documents and answering calls.
meanings.sent2: She found the clerkish responsibilities challenging but rewarding.
meanings.sent3: The cat's clerkish behavior of pawing at the keyboard amused everyone in the office.
meanings.sent4: The clerkish precision with which he organized his schedule was impressive.
meanings.sent5: The clerkish attention to detail ensured that no errors were made in the report.

meanings.definition: having the qualities or characteristics of a clerk
meanings.sent1: His clerkish nature made him excel in administrative tasks.
meanings.sent2: The team appreciated her clerkish efficiency in managing paperwork.
meanings.sent3: The dog's clerkish habit of organizing its toys in a row was endearing.
meanings.sent4: The clerkish precision with which she labeled the files was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The clerkish dedication to his job earned him the respect of his colleagues.
